intro: Raphanocarpus welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's radish, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant features a robust taproot that can grow quite deep into the soil, often reaching lengths of over a meter. Its leaves are large, lobed, and somewhat hairy, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
